item.title: Paula add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Paula add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "Let me tell you this: if you meet a loner, no matter what they tell you, it's not because they enjoy solitude. It's because they have tried to blend into the world before, and people continue to disappoint them." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Paula add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I have a history of making decisions very quickly about men. I have always fallen in love fast and without measuring risks. I have a tendency not only to see the best in everyone, but to assume that everyone is emotionally capable of reaching his highest potential. I have fallen in love more times than I care to count with the highest potential of a man, rather than with the man himself, and I have hung on to the relationship for a long time (sometimes far too long) waiting for the man to ascend to his own greatness. Many times in romance I have been a victim of my own optimism." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Paula add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"I agree with yours of the 22d that <b>a professorship of Theology should have no place in our institution</b>. but we cannot always do what is absolutely best. those with whom we act, entertaining different views, have the power and the right of carrying them into practice. truth advances, & error recedes step by step only; and to do to our fellow-men the most good in our power, we must lead where we can, follow where we cannot, and still go with them, watching always the favorable moment for helping them to another step.
[<i>Comment on establishing Jefferson's University of Virginia, a secular college, in a letter to Thomas Cooper 7 October 1814</i>]" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Paula add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Paula add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Paula add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Paula add a quote by Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: "The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it." -- Neil deGrasse Tyson

item.title: Paula add a quote by Walt Disney Company
item.description: "Around here, however, we don't look backwards for very long. We keep moving forward, opening up new doors and doing new things, because we're curious...and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths." -- Walt Disney Company

item.title: Paula add a quote by Lewis Caroll
item.description: "Oh, you can't help that,' said the cat. 'We're all mad here." -- Lewis Caroll

item.title: Paula add a quote by Cheshire Cat
item.description: "We're all mad here." -- Cheshire Cat

item.title: Paula add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Paula add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness. Armour yourself in it, and it will never be used to hurt you." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Paula add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "If Socrates leaves his house today he will find the sage seated on his doorstep. If Judas go forth tonight it is to Judas his steps will tend.â€™ Every life is many days, day after day. We walk through ourselves, meeting robbers, ghosts, giants, old men, young men, wives, widows, brothers-in-law. But always meeting ourselves." -- James Joyce

item.title: Paula add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I don't think..." then you shouldn't talk, said the Hatter." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Paula add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Do you know, I always thought unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!"
Well, now that we have seen each other," said the unicorn, "if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Paula add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "In a Wonderland they lie, Dreaming as the days go by, Dreaming as the summers die: Ever drifting down the stream- Lingering in the golden gleam- Life, what is it but a dream?" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Paula add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "what matters most is how well you walk through the fire" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Paula add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"and when love came to us twice and lied to us twice we decided to never love again that was fair fair to us and fair to love itself.
we ask for no mercy or no miracles; we are strong enough to live and to die and to kill flies,
attend the boxing matches, go to the racetrack, live on luck and skill, get alone, get alone often, and if you can't sleep alone be careful of the words you speak in your sleep; and ask for no mercy no miracles;
and don't forget: time is meant to be wasted, love fails and death is useless." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Paula add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Too often the people complain that they have done nothing with their lives and then they wait for somebody to tell them that this isn't so." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Paula add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "There are times when those eyes inside your brain stare back at you." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Paula add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I will remember the kisses our lips raw with love and how you gave me everything you had and how I offered you what was left of me, and I will remember your small room the feel of you the light in the window your records your books our morning coffee our noons our nights our bodies spilled together sleeping the tiny flowing currents immediate and forever your leg my leg your arm my arm your smile and the warmth of you who made me laugh again." -- Charles Bukowski
